avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: Fresh poorly bonded windslab will be deposited from the start of the day, mostly on South-West though West to North-West aspects above 850 metres. Steep wind sheltered locations, such as coire rims, convexities and gully tops will be affected. Slopes exposed to wind will be scoured, while at lower elevations snow patches will remain moist and stable. Cornices will build from early in the day. The avalanche hazard will be Moderate.
avalancheActivity.highlights: NC for 12.12. Poorly bonded windslab building SW,W and NW aspects above 850 metres. Cornices building. Avalanche Hazard Moderate.

snowpackStructure.comment:
Forecast Weather Influences: After a dry night precipitation is expected throughout the day, this falling as light snow above 800 metres. Winds will be strong East-South-Easterly overnight, backing to become very strong from the East by mid morning. The freezing level will be around 800 metres.
Observed Weather Influences: A day of poor visibility with very light rain falling as a dusting of snow above 950 metres. The freezing level was around 1000 metres. Winds were fresh and from the East.
ObservedSnowStability: The snowpack is moist and consolidated in most locations, with a widespread soft crust. Stability was observed to be good, as the snow pack continues to consolidate in the fluctuating temperatures. Cornices were observed above Northerly aspects around coire rims. The avalanche hazard is Low.

avalancheActivity.comment: Forecast Snow Stability: SAIS daily public avalanche reports ended on 16th April 2023. Snowpack conditions will be monitored but it is expected that no further public avalanche reports will be issued. Thank you for your support. With thanks from the SAIS team.
avalancheActivity.highlights: 16.4.23: SAIS reports ended for this season. Conditions will be monitored but it\'s expected that no reports will be issued. Thanks.
